content: wrist-ticklers these sweet little wristers started life as they are perfectly lightweight and yet a pair of scrappy socks keep your hands and wrists lovely and toasty as i was knitting them i was enjoying working the relaxing rounds so much you only need a small amount of yarn that i decided to just carry on in no so they make the perfect project for time at all i had a cute pair of wrist your leftovers warmers how many pairs will you make i wear the first pair i made almost every day when out for my morning walk wrist-ticklers this pattern is for personal use only - © 2020 kay jones do not reproduce kay@bakerybears co uk yarn 40g 170 metres or 185 yards of fingering weight yarn sample 1 was knitted using various gauge leftovers of fingering weight yarn sample 2 was knitted using a mini skein set from 36 stitches and 48 row = 4 inches/10cm pixie yarns in the colourway gingerbread washed and blocked measurement in tango stocking stitch finished dimensions the finished wristers measure 8 5 inches 21 5 cm in length and 7 inches 17 5 cm in circumference this is a washed and blocked measurement unstretched they will fit an average ladies hand 7 to 8 inches in circumference with a nice amount of ease notions 2 25mm us size 1 32 inch 80 cm circular knitting needle for knitting the magic loop method you can use double pointed needles or any other preferred method tapestry needle abbreviations k - knit p - purl wrist-ticklers this pattern is for personal use only - © 2020 kay jones do not reproduce kay@bakerybears co uk pattern notes you can knit your wristers in whatever fingering weight yarn you like i like to knit mine using scraps or mini skeins but you could use just one yarn if you prefer you might knit the top and bottom cuffs in a contrast yarn and then a different yarn for the body of the wrister it s great fun to stripe your yarns as i did in sample 2 but this is entirely up to you the pattern is a basic outline so that you can then choose how to personalise them each wrister takes approximately 20g of yarn but this will vary depending on how long you choose to knit them i give details on the final page of my two samples top cuff cast on 64 stitches and join for knitting in the round i cast on using the long tail method after knitting a few rounds i like to attach a progress keeper or locking stitch marker to the front of my work round 1 - k2 p2 repeat to the end of the round repeat this round a total of 12 times or your preferred cuff length wrist-ticklers this pattern is for personal use only - © 2020 kay jones 2 do not reproduce kay@bakerybears co uk wrister body knit for 80 rounds
